channel.title: Network Tips
channel.description: Tips and tutorials about networking classes of ESTG-IPVC with proper syntax highlighted.

item.title: Setup a DHCP server - Linux
item.description: The Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol (DHCP) is a standardized network protocol used on Internet Protocol (IP) networks for dynamically distributing network configuration parameters, such as IP addresses for interfaces and services. With DHCP, computers request IP addresses and networking parameters automatically from a DHCP server,...

item.title: TCP/UDP Sockets - Linux
item.description: A network socket is an endpoint of an inter-process communication across a computer network. Today, most communication between computers is based on the Internet Protocol, therefore most network sockets are Internet sockets. A socket address is the combination of an IP address and a port...

item.title: Setup a DNS server - Linux
item.description: The Domain Name System, or DNS, is one of the Internet’s fundamental building blocks. It is the global, hierarchical, and distributed host information database that’s responsible for translating names into addresses and vice versa, routing mail to its proper destination, and many other services. If...

item.title: Setup a Email server - Linux
item.description: Simple Mail Transfer Protocol (SMTP) is an Internet standard for electronic mail (email) transmission. SMTP by default uses TCP port 25. The protocol for mail submission is the same, but uses port 587. Sendmail was one of the first mail transfer agents to implement SMTP....

item.title: Setup a FTP server - Linux
item.description: The File Transfer Protocol (FTP) is a standard network protocol used to transfer computer files between a client and server on a computer network. FTP is built on a client-server model architecture and uses separate control and data connections between the client and the server....

item.title: Setup a Apache server - Linux
item.description: A web server processes requests via HTTP, the basic network protocol used to distribute information on the World Wide Web. The primary function of a web server is to store, process and deliver web pages to clients. The communication between client and server takes place...

item.title: Protocol Stack
item.description: The protocol stack is an implementation of a computer networking protocol suite. The suite is the definition of the protocols, and the stack is the software implementation of them. In practical, protocol stacks are divided into three major sections: media, transport, and applications. Lets see...
